p: The cytotoxic effects exhibited by essential oils could be related to an overall action of the compounds present in oils, especially to sesquiterpene compounds [ 32, 33], phenols, alcohols, and monoterpene aldehydes [ 34, 35]. TA-1, with its bioactive compounds, and hydrosol elicit a cytotoxic effect by inhibiting cell viability. In the study done by El Hadri et al. [ 36], α-humulene was found to be cytotoxic against MCF-7, HCT-116, and murine macrophage (RAW264.7) cell lines. The cytotoxic potential of β-pinene was investigated in MCF-7, A375, and HepG2 cancer cells and in other different tumor and nontumor cell lines [ 37]. In fact, the studies of the cytotoxicity of cancer cell lines towards essential oils demonstrate a great difference between them with respect to their sensitivity to the substances contained in the oily fraction [ 38] of TA-1.
